subject: Real Estate
title: The 30-Year Mortgage Revolution
description: A micro-lesson that makes The 30-Year Mortgage Revolution usable.

hook.text: Before the 1930s, mortgages lasted just 5 years and required 50% down. Homeownership was for the rich.

buildup.text: The Great Depression caused a wave of foreclosures. Banks called in loans that nobody could repay.

discovery.text: FDR's New Deal created the FHA, which insured 30-year mortgages with just 10% down.

twist.text: Banks no longer feared lending long-term. The risk shifted to the government â€” meaning taxpayers.

climax.text: Homeownership jumped from 44% in 1940 to 62% by 1960. The middle class was built on cheap debt.

punchline.text: Thirty-year debt created the American homeowner.

quiz.question: What did the FHA do to change homeownership?
